body.p:
To His Excellency
Thos E. Bramlette Gov of Ky.

Your Petitioner Walker Cox, resident of Adair County Ky. & who resides near the Casey & Taylor County lines. & 20 Miles from Columbia; states that he is Indicted in the Adair Circuit Court for Hog Stealing which is & of which he is innocent.

He says at the request of James Chelf he did assist him the said Chelf to kill Two Hogs in the daytime & which were dressed at the House of said Chelf which Hogs Chelf said were wild hogs & pestering his feeding place, & which your petitioner thought was & still believes to be true. & twelve months afterwards & after said Chelf fell out with him he the said Chelf procured said Indictment. That it is a great distance to attend trial & he Two of of His witness by whom he can contradict & invalidate said Chelf one So infirm & old that he cannot procure their attendance at Court.

We the citizens & neighbors of said Walker Cox, who know him both before & since his return from the Federal Army. Say that we believe said Walker
Cox ^innocent^ of any blame in the said Indictment charged & believe the charge against him grounless & pray the govr to pardon him from the charges in the Indictment.
